overview.title: Ray Tracer
overview.description: A ray tracer written in C++ for the course of Graphics Programming 1 at DAE.

description.title: What is it?
description.content: A ray tracer written in C++ for the course of Graphics Programming 1 at DAE.

sections.title: Objective
sections.content: For this course, we were tasked with creating a ray tracer during the course of one semester. It taught me a lot about how rendering in games is actually done.

sections.title: Capabilities
sections.content: The program can render both mathematical spheres and planes, as well as triangles. It can also load in .obj files and render them using those triangles.

sections.title: Level Editing
sections.content: While not required by the course, I was intrigued by the idea of being able to move things around the level. Thus I spent a bit of time implementing a raycast, selection, and movement logic.
